17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsThe ITI Talent SummitThe ITI Talent Summit is a premier event connecting industry needs with Egypt’s future tech professionals. Under the theme “Where Bright Minds Meet Future Opportunities” it brings together local and global organizations for collaboration, talent access, and knowledge exchange.Read MoreThe Armed ForcesThe Armed Forces, in cooperation with the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology, organized a meeting for a number of conscripts in the Armed Forces who are graduates of engineering faculties (Computer Engineering specialization) and faculties of computer and information sciences. The meeting aimed to introduce the ITI (Information Technology Institute) initiative for training conscripts.Read MoreITI Tech-Law CeremonyDr. Amr Talaat, Minister of Communications and Information Technology, attended the graduation ceremony of the first cohort of the "ITI Tech-Law" program in Law and Technology. He also inaugurated the official launch of the program’s digital version on the Information Technology Institute’s online platform "MaharaTech". The event took place at the ITI headquarters in Smart Village, in line with the state’s efforts to build digital capacities across various societal segments and to promote the integration of modern technologies into different disciplines.Read MoreProfessional Training Scholarships – (9 –month )The program offers a full scholarship to Egyptian university graduates within five years of graduation, aiming at bridge the skills gap between talent supply and market demands. It collaborates with industry partners to provide over 32 specialized tracks, selecting candidates through a rigorous process with a 10% acceptance rate. Delivered in a hybrid model, the program focuses on creating passionate, committed, and resilient leaders in the ICT sector.Read MoreIntensive Code Camps – (4 month)Intensive Code Camp (ICC) program provides a wide range of different tracks that are aligned with the Egyptian governorates’ local identity as well as the relative market needs such as Textile Design in Mahalla, 3D Furniture Design in Damietta, Solar Power in Siwa, Web Development for Tourism in Aswan, Digital Marketing and e-Content in Hurghada and many more. ICC is implemented in collaboration with the governorates training centers to capitalize on the existing infrastructure and reach out youth in rural areas.Read MoreEarly Career Build Up (Summer Training)Developing human cadres and providing specialized consultation services for individuals and entities in the ICT domain, ITI Early Career Build Up Program was initiated in 2019 as one of the most ambitious programs that inspires Egyptian youth to deepen their technological knowledge and shape their careers in the competitive ICT markets.Read MoreYoung Talent for Future Technologies (Junior Training)The ITI Juniors camps aim at building the computational thinking skills starting age group 10 years old.
Mind- Junior camps chose to nature exploration, promote problem solving and embrace logical thinking and creativity with special focus on building the ICT specializations such as Cyber Security, Embedded Systems, Digital Arts and Game Development in preparation for tomorrow’s jobs.Read MoreTech-LawThe Tech-Law Track is aimed at law graduates to keep up with technological developments and challenges. It equips and empowers lawyers with a strong foundation in technology-related legal matters, to effectively navigate the evolving legal landscape in the digital era and provide valuable legal services to clients operating in the technology sector.Read MoreEgypt Makes Electronicsthe Egypt Makes Electronics (EME) Initiative
A presidential initiative aimed at boosting the electronics industry as a key driver of economic growth, under the supervision of the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology.

Role of the Information Technology Institute (ITI):
ITI provides specialized training programs in:

Core Engineering Specializations: Embedded Systems, Cybersecurity, E-Mobility, Digital & Analog IC Design & Verification.
Supportive Programs: LTE Networks Engineering, Software Testing, AI & Machine Learning, Industrial Automation,  IoT Applications and Android Automotive.Read MoreMahara-TechMahara-Tech, an online platform by ITI (Information Technology Institute), offers high-quality tech training for Arabic speakers. It provides specialized courses in high-demand ICT fields, including cybersecurity, data analysis, programming (Java/Open Source/.Net), cloud computing, IoT, embedded systems, and quality assurance & testing.

The platform bridges the gap between technical skills and online job opportunities through:

Freelancing market insights, presented by top Arabic experts.
Success stories of freelancers from diverse educational backgrounds.
Networking with freelancing platforms and tailored sessions on starting an online career.
Mahara-Tech serves as a comprehensive gateway for digital learning and career advancement in the tech industry.Read MoreFreelancingFreelancingThe Work from Home Initiative, offered by the Information Technology Institute (ITI), is dedicated to empowering individuals to embrace freelancing and remote work opportunities. At the heart of our mission are four foundational pillars: Training, Mentorship, Inspiration, and Career, each designed to support you from the initial stages of your freelancing journey to long-term professional growth.Read MoreMilitary Training InitiativeThe Armed Forces Information Systems Department has signed a cooperation protocol with the Information Technology Institute (ITI), affiliated with the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology, to qualify conscripts for the labor market through partnerships with specialized companies in the field of information technology. This initiative is the first of its kind, offering a professional training scholarship that is counted within the conscription period. The training duration ranges from 4 to 9 months as part of the institute’s training programs, aiming to equip conscripts with in-demand skills in the field of information technology.Read MoreThe Egyptian Tax AuthorityRead MoreITI In NumbersQuick facts about ITI32+IT Specializations85%Annual Employment Rate500+Companies80+Universities & FacultiesExplore ITIOur PartnersWe’re pleased to work with several Academic and Industrial PartnersAcademia PartnersIndustry PartnersIf you want to become one of our partners, Kindly send us an email onITIinfo@iti.gov.egTestimonialsWhat people say about usMr.Nils VogelDirector of Operations and Projects at Vector InternationalI am deeply pleased with the fruitful collaboration with the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology and its affiliated entities, particularly the Information Technology Institute (ITI), to support young Egyptian talents who possess promising potential in the advanced electronics indus...Read moreMr.Luz MauchDXC Luxoft Vice PresidentThe Information Technology Institute is graduating highly skilled Androide Automotive developers. He praised Egypt's dynamic and multilingual workforce, as well as its cost-effective proximity to Europe, as significant advantages for attracting global technology investments. Mr. Mauch further explai...Read moreDr.John KellyVice President Research, IBMI had the opportunity to talk to the ITI students; I can assure you that you have the most talented and well educated calibers, there is no doubt that your country will have a bright future.Dr.Ruhakana RugundaPrime Minister of UgandaThe fruitful cooperation with ITI emphasizes the strong historical ties between Egypt and Uganda. I hope wish to thank ITI for its successful role in the field of HCB for BPO cadres in Uganda.Prof Dr.Jurgen GausemeierThe day to day cooperation between the ITI and the University of Paderborn works very smoothly and successfully. I’m very proud of our joint protocol that I consider the best we have in the region, I deeply appreciate your visionary power and your straight ahead mentality.Dr.Howard ArmitageThrough your over two decades of experience, ITI has accumulated and developed significant experience and expertise in producing high quality development capacity programs. ITI as an institute that not only plays a critical role in ITC capacity building in Egypt, that it carries over this mission ve...Read moreAhmed Abd El HalimI’ve always wanted to start my own company but I had my share of fears blocking the way. When I joined the ITI, I got to learn the technological knowledge I needed in addition to, the managerial skills I needed to set my fear aside and helped my gain the confidence to pursue my dream.Over 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global
        tech trends, as well as the country’s national and mega projects, hence; sustaining its graduates’ employment
        percentage to 85 prior their graduation.QUICK LINKSAbout UsBranchesNewsContact usKEEP IN TOUCH17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egCopyright ©2022 All Rights Reserved. Read More Egypt Makes Electronicsthe Egypt Makes Electronics (EME) Initiative
A presidential initiative aimed at boosting the electronics industry as a key driver of economic growth, under the supervision of the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology.

Role of the Information Technology Institute (ITI):
ITI provides specialized training programs in:

Core Engineering Specializations: Embedded Systems, Cybersecurity, E-Mobility, Digital & Analog IC Design & Verification.

Read More Mahara-TechMahara-Tech, an online platform by ITI (Information Technology Institute), offers high-quality tech training for Arabic speakers. It provides specialized courses in high-demand ICT fields, including cybersecurity, data analysis, programming (Java/Open Source/.Net), cloud computing, IoT, embedded systems, and quality assurance & testing.

The platform bridges the gap between technical skills and online job opportunities through:

Freelancing market insights, presented by top Arabic experts.
Success stories of freelancers from diverse educational backgrounds.
Networking with freelancing platforms and tailored sessions on starting an online career.
Mahara-Tech serves as a comprehensive gateway for digital learning and career advancement in the tech industry.Read More Mahara-TechMahara-Tech, an online platform by ITI (Information Technology Institute), offers high-quality tech training for Arabic speakers. Read More Military Training InitiativeThe Armed Forces Information Systems Department has signed a cooperation protocol with the Information Technology Institute (ITI), affiliated with the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology, to qualify conscripts for the labor market through partnerships with specialized companies in the field of information technology. This initiative is the first of its kind, offering a professional training scholarship that is counted within the conscription period. for individuals and entities in the ICT domain, ITI Early Career Build Up Program was initiated in 2019 as one of the most ambitious that inspires Egyptian youth to deepen their technological knowledge and shape their careers in the competitive ICT markets. Young Talent for Future Technologies (Junior Training)The ITI camps aim at building the computational thinking skills starting age group 10 years old. Mind- Junior camps chose to nature exploration, promote problem solving and embrace logical thinking and creativity with special focus on building the ICT specializations such as Cyber Security, Embedded Systems, Digital Arts and Game Development in preparation for tomorrow’s jobs. Tech-LawThe Tech-Law Track is aimed at law graduates to keep up with technological developments and challenges. It equips and empowers lawyers with a strong foundation in technology-related legal matters, to effectively navigate the evolving legal landscape in the digital era and provide valuable legal to clients operating in the technology sector. Egypt Makes Electronicsthe Egypt Makes Electronics (EME) Initiative
A presidential initiative aimed at boosting the electronics industry as a key driver of economic growth, under the supervision of the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology. Role of the Information Technology Institute (ITI):
ITI provides specialized training in: Core Engineering Specializations: Embedded Systems, Cybersecurity, E-Mobility, Digital & Analog IC Design & Verification.
Supportive : LTE Networks Engineering, Software Testing, AI & Machine Learning, Industrial Automation, IoT Applications and Android Automotive. Mahara-TechMahara-Tech, an online platform by ITI (Information Technology Institute), offers high-quality tech training for Arabic speakers. It provides specialized courses in high-demand ICT fields, including cybersecurity, data analysis, programming (Java/Open Source/.Net), cloud computing, IoT, embedded systems, and quality assurance & testing. The platform bridges the gap between technical skills and online job opportunities through: Freelancing market insights, presented by top Arabic experts.
Success stories of freelancers from diverse educational backgrounds.

Networking with freelancing platforms and tailored sessions on starting an online career.
Mahara-Tech serves as a comprehensive gateway for digital learning and career advancement in the tech industry. FreelancingFreelancingThe Work from Initiative, offered by the Information Technology Institute (ITI), is dedicated to empowering individuals to embrace freelancing and remote work opportunities. At the heart of our mission are four foundational pillars: Training, Mentorship, Inspiration, and Career, each designed to support you from the initial stages of your freelancing journey to long-term professional growth. Military Training InitiativeThe Armed Forces Information Systems Department has signed a cooperation protocol with the Information Technology Institute (ITI), affiliated with the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology, to qualify conscripts for the labor market through partnerships with specialized companies in the field of information technology. This initiative is the first of its kind, offering a professional training scholarship that is counted within the conscription period. The training duration ranges from 4 to 9 months as part of the institute’s training , aiming to equip conscripts with in-demand skills in the field of information technology. The Egyptian Tax Authority The ITI Talent SummitThe ITI Talent Summit is a premier event connecting industry needs with Egypt’s future tech professionals. Under the theme “Where Bright Minds Meet Future Opportunities” it brings together local and global organizations for collaboration, talent access, and knowledge exchange. The Armed ForcesThe Armed Forces, in cooperation with the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology, organized a meeting for a number of conscripts in the Armed Forces who are graduates of engineering faculties (Computer Engineering specialization) and faculties of computer and information sciences. The meeting aimed to introduce the ITI (Information Technology Institute) initiative for training conscripts. ITI Tech-Law CeremonyDr. Amr Talaat, Minister of Communications and Information Technology, attended the graduation ceremony of the first cohort of the "ITI Tech-Law" program in Law and Technology. He also inaugurated the official launch of the program’s digital version on the Information Technology Institute’s online platform "MaharaTech". The event took place at the ITI headquarters in Smart Village, in line with the state’s efforts to build digital capacities across various societal segments and to promote the integration of modern technologies into different disciplines. Professional Training Scholarships – (9 –month )The program offers a full scholarship to Egyptian university graduates within five years of graduation, aiming at bridge the skills gap between talent supply and market demands. It collaborates with industry partners to provide over 32 specialized tracks, selecting candidates through a rigorous process with a 10% acceptance rate. Delivered in a hybrid model, the program focuses on creating passionate, committed, and resilient leaders in the ICT sector. Intensive Code Camps – (4 month)Intensive Code Camp (ICC) program provides a wide range of different tracks that are aligned with the Egyptian governorates’ local identity as well as the relative market needs such as Textile Design in Mahalla, 3D Furniture Design in Damietta, Solar Power in Siwa, Web Development for Tourism in Aswan, Digital Marketing and e-Content in Hurghada and many more. ICC is implemented in collaboration with the governorates training centers to capitalize on the existing infrastructure and reach out youth in rural areas. Early Career Build Up (Summer Training)Developing human cadres and providing specialized consultation for individuals and entities in the ICT domain, ITI Early Career Build Up Program was initiated in 2019 as one of the most ambitious that inspires Egyptian youth to deepen their technological knowledge and shape their careers in the competitive ICT markets. Young Talent for Future Technologies (Junior Training)The ITI camps aim at building the computational thinking skills starting age group 10 years old. Mind- Junior camps chose to nature exploration, promote problem solving and embrace logical thinking and creativity with special focus on building the ICT specializations such as Cyber Security, Embedded Systems, Digital Arts and Game Development in preparation for tomorrow’s jobs. Tech-LawThe Tech-Law Track is aimed at law graduates to keep up with technological developments and challenges. It equips and empowers lawyers with a strong foundation in technology-related legal matters, to effectively navigate the evolving legal landscape in the digital era and provide valuable legal to clients operating in the technology sector. Mind- Junior camps chose to nature exploration, promote problem solving and embrace logical thinking and creativity with special focus on building the ICT specializations such as Cyber Security, Embedded Systems, Digital Arts and Game Development in preparation for tomorrow’s jobs. Tech-LawThe Tech-Law Track is aimed at law graduates to keep up with technological developments and challenges. It equips and empowers lawyers with a strong foundation in technology-related legal matters, to effectively navigate the evolving legal landscape in the digital era and provide valuable legal to clients operating in the technology sector. Egypt Makes Electronicsthe Egypt Makes Electronics (EME) Initiative
A presidential initiative aimed at boosting the electronics industry as a key driver of economic growth, under the supervision of the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology. Role of the Information Technology Institute (ITI):
ITI provides specialized training in: Core Engineering Specializations: Embedded Systems, Cybersecurity, E-Mobility, Digital & Analog IC Design & Verification.
Supportive : LTE Networks Engineering, Software Testing, AI & Machine Learning, Industrial Automation, IoT Applications and Android Automotive. Egypt Makes Electronicsthe Egypt Makes Electronics (EME) Initiative

Mahara-TechMahara-Tech, an online platform by ITI (Information Technology Institute), offers high-quality tech training for Arabic speakers. It provides specialized courses in high-demand ICT fields, including cybersecurity, data analysis, programming (Java/Open Source/.Net), cloud computing, IoT, embedded systems, and quality assurance & testing. The platform bridges the gap between technical skills and online job opportunities through: Freelancing market insights, presented by top Arabic experts.
Success stories of freelancers from diverse educational backgrounds.
Networking with freelancing platforms and tailored sessions on starting an online career.
Mahara-Tech serves as a comprehensive gateway for digital learning and career advancement in the tech industry. 17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsAbout ITIhome>about ITIITI In BriefThe Information Technology Institute (ITI) was established back in 1993 and became one of the MCIT’s affiliates in 2005.  Its main mission revolves around ICT human capacity development. For over 30 years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through  continuous monitoring of  future global tech trends, as well as the country’s national and mega projects.   As a result, it sustained an 85%  employment percentage for its graduates. 
ITI programs served thousands of Egyptian youth from different Egyptian governorates, who  graduated from different academic backgrounds, thanks to the rich programs that built on their academic experience  leveraging their future employment opportunities. These programs include development, content design, game development, Geographic Information System, media and animation, cloud, security, data analytics, among others. ITI has a wide network of relations with industry and academia, empowering its curriculum and helping in reaching out talents in most of Egypt’s universities and governorates.missionSupporting Egyptian youth to improve their career opportunities by developing their skills and preparing them for highly in-demand 
jobs, and related vast technologies to fulfill today’s needs, and tomorrow’s forecast.visionA Reference Hub in Developing ICT Professional Talents.valuesPeople Develop Countries… We Develop PEOPLEpprofessionalismEElationoopennessppassionlloyaltyEExtra MileAffiliationThe MCIT strategy is to develop the ICT infrastructure and industry, transforming Egypt into a global digital hub. Information Technology Institute works to empower Egypt’s youth with the tools and skills needed to develop and live in a knowledge-based society, while using the ICT tools to boost the country’s competitiveness, productivity and the national, regional & international development.- Dr. Amr Talaat, Minister of Communications and Information Technology -Chairperson's MessageBeing committed to develop highly skilled and well-trained cadres who are able to effectively contributing to our country’s development and with around 30 years in the field of ICT capacity development, ITI always keeps an eye on the accelerated market needs, engaging the industry key players and reflecting continuous changes on our designed programs.
Thus, enabling ITI to scale up its services reaching our more passionate learners all over Egypt.- Dr. Heba Saleh, ITI Chairperson -Meet The LeadersAmr El ShafeyChairman Assistant for Training and Projectsamshafey@iti.gov.eg+202-35355580Mohamed HanafyChairman Assistant for Qualitymohanafy@iti.gov.eg+202-3906926Ahmed LotfyIntensive Training Programahloutfy@iti.gov.eg+202-35355507Sherif SharafProfessional Training Programshsharaf@iti.gov.eg+202-35355583ITI FoundersFormer ITI foundersDr. Hisham El-sherifFounder and Former Director of The Information and decision support centerDr. Nabil SaiedFormer ITI ChairmanDr. Nabil El NadyFormer Deputy of The Information and decision support centerDr. Mohamed SalemFormer Minister of Communications and Information TechnologyOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global
        tech trends, as well as the country’s national and mega projects, hence; sustaining its graduates’ employment
        percentage to 85 prior their graduation.QUICK LINKSAbout UsBranchesNewsContact usKEEP IN TOUCH17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egCopyright ©2022 All Rights Reserved. ITI programs served thousands of Egyptian youth from different Egyptian governorates, who  graduated from different academic backgrounds, thanks to the rich programs that built on their academic experience  leveraging their future employment opportunities. These programs include development, content design, game development, Geographic Information System, media and animation, cloud, security, data analytics, among others. ITI has a wide network of relations with industry and academia, empowering its curriculum and helping in reaching out talents in most of Egypt’s universities and governorates. missionSupporting Egyptian youth to improve their career opportunities by developing their skills and preparing them for highly in-demand

clean: ITIITI In BriefThe Information Technology Institute (ITI) was established back in 1993 and became one of the MCIT’s affiliates in 2005. Its main mission revolves around ICT human capacity development. For over 30 years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring of future global tech trends, as well as the country’s national and mega projects. As a result, it sustained an 85% employment percentage for its graduates. ITI served thousands of Egyptian youth from different Egyptian governorates, who graduated from different academic backgrounds, thanks to the rich that built on their academic experience leveraging their future employment opportunities. These include development, content design, game development, Geographic Information System, media and animation, cloud, security, data analytics, among others. ITI has a wide network of relations with industry and academia, empowering its curriculum and helping in reaching out talents in most of Egypt’s universities and governorates.missionSupporting Egyptian youth to improve their career opportunities by developing their skills and preparing them for highly in-demand jobs, and related vast technologies to fulfill today’s needs, and tomorrow’s forecast.visionA Reference Hub in Developing ICT Professional Talents.valuesPeople Develop Countries… We Develop PEOPLEpprofessionalismEElationoopennessppassionlloyaltyEExtra MileAffiliationThe MCIT strategy is to develop the ICT infrastructure and industry, transforming Egypt into a global digital hub. 17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsnewshome>NewsITI NewsOur Latest Newsمعهد تكنولوجيا المعلومات يشارك في TechUp Women Summit ’2501 November 2025Share News:في معهد تكنولوجيا المعلومات (ITI) نؤمن بدور المرأة كشريك أساسي في قيادة التحول الرقمي وصناعة المستقبل.
مشاركتنا في TechUp Women Summit ’25 تأتي استمرارًا لرحلتنا في تمكين الكوادر النسائية، ودعم مزيد من الفتيات والسيدات ليصبحن جاهزات لسوق العمل وقادرات على الابتكار في مجالات التكنولوجيا المختلفة.
في انتظاركم يوم السبت 8 نوفمبر 2025، في الجريك كامبس (The Greek Campus) بالقاهرة.Previous NewsAll NewsNext NewsOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global
        tech trends, as well as the country’s national and mega projects, hence; sustaining its graduates’ employment
        percentage to 85 prior their graduation.QUICK LINKSAbout UsBranchesNewsContact usKEEP IN TOUCH17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egCopyright ©2022 All Rights Reserved. في انتظاركم يوم السبت 8 نوفمبر 2025، في الجريك كامبس (The Greek Campus) بالقاهرة. 17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsnewshome>NewsITI NewsOur Latest Newsفتح التسجيل ببرنامج التدريب المكثف بمعهد تكنولوجيا المعلومات01 November 2025Share News:يعلن معهد تكنولوجيا المعلومات عن فتح باب التسجيل لمنحة برنامج التدريب المكثف بفروعه في المحافظات المختلفة ومراكز إبداع مصر الرقمية في تخصصات تكنولوجية متميزة لخريجي الجامعات المصرية من عام 2016 وحتى عام 2025.

- لمعرفة المسارات المتاحة في كل فرع يرجى زيارة رابط التسجيل.
- المستندات المطلوبة ومراحل التسجيل موضحة برابط التسجيل.
- نظام الحضور بالدورات التدريبية هو نظام مختلط (Blended Learning).
- يبدأ التسجيل اعتباراً من يوم السبت الموافق 1 نوفمبر 2025، ويستمر حتى يوم الإثنين الموافق 10 نوفمبر 2025.

- يتم التسجيل من خلال الرابط التالي على الموقع الرسمي لمعهد تكنولوجيا المعلومات:

- لمعرفة المسارات المتاحة في كل فرع يرجى زيارة رابط التسجيل.

content:
17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsServiceshome>Post GraduatesPost Graduates ProgramsProfessional Training Program - (9 Months)Program DescriptionThis program offers a comprehensive scholarship for Egyptian university graduates who have completed their studies within the past five years. It serves as a catalyst to bridge the gap between the skills of talented graduates and the demands of the local, regional, and international job markets. Through collaboration with a diverse network of industry partners, we have designed over 32 different tracks to align with specific job profiles and ICT market competencies. 
Candidates undergo a rigorous screening process and around 10% are accepted in this program, which spans over 9 months starting October every year.

17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsServiceshome>Under GraduatesUnder Graduates ProgramsEarly Career Build Up - (Summer Training)Program DescriptionInformation Technology Institute (ITI) always seeks scaling up different services. We partner with Universities to create tech-camps sponsored and conducted with them in order to extend ITl's mission and to provide rapid and equal access to learning and knowledge transfer to massive population capacities through-out Egypt.

In collaboration with the university, it has been agreed to design and conduct intensive training summer code-camps to undergraduates during their summer vacation to elevate their readiness to the market prior their graduation.

The design of the camps is guided by the growing demand for specific skills and technologies in the market to help the students find a job or internship in technologies like Android development, Open source development. IOT applications development, Cross platform mobile development, loS application  development, Computer   Networks, Ethical Hacking, Embedded systems, Robotics, GIS, Digital marketing, Furniture Design & Visualization, Architecture Design & visualization and Digital Arts. Camps are designed to target around 20000 students/year.feesFully Funded ScholarshipGraduates45k GraduatesDuration1 MonthWho is eligible to applyGender :Males and FemalesNationality :EgyptianMilitary Service :All military statuses are allowed.Educational Degree :Bachelor DegreeDownload Student GuideOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

        percentage to 85 prior their graduation.QUICK LINKSAbout UsBranchesNewsContact usKEEP IN TOUCH17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egCopyright ©2022 All Rights Reserved. IOT applications development, Cross platform mobile development, loS application development, Computer Networks, Ethical Hacking, Embedded systems, Robotics, GIS, Digital marketing, Furniture Design & Visualization, Architecture Design & visualization and Digital Arts. 17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsServiceshome>Tech-BusinessTech-Business ProgramsIT for Law Practitioners - (Tech-Law)Program DescriptionThe Tech-Law Track is aimed at law graduates to keep up with technological developments and challenges.  It equips and empowers lawyers with a strong foundation in technology-related legal matters, to effectively navigate the evolving legal landscape in the digital era and provide valuable legal services to clients operating in the technology sector.
During this track Trainers will be provided with a solid understanding of the technology-related aspects relevant to their legal practice leveraging CS50 for Lawyers training program provided by Harvard University. They will also learn intellectual property rights in the digital age and advise clients on intellectual property matters in the technology sector. The track will conclude by exploring technology laws and regulations and addressing the local and international legal frameworks related to information technology. 
Throughout the course, Trainers will be introduced to Freelancing skills and disruptive technologies to stay ahead of new dynamic ways of working and to provide tech-driven legal services in an increasingly digital world.
Trainers will develop practical skills using practical exercises, case studies, and real-world examples to enhance their ability to apply their knowledge in practice. This may involve analyzing technology contracts, drafting legal opinions on emerging technological issues, or providing legal advice on compliance with technology laws.feesFully Funded ScholarshipGraduates55 GraduatesDuration6 MonthsWho is eligible to applyGender :Males and FemalesNationality :EgyptianMilitary Service :Deferred or Exempted or CompletedEducational Degree :Bachelor DegreeGraduation Year :At Least 1 years from graduationPREVIOUSINTAKESRead MoreDownload Student GuideOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsServiceshome>JuniorsJuniors
 ProgramsJunior Camps - (Junior Academy)Program DescriptionITI Junior Academy is a specialized training initiative designed for young individuals who are interested in exploring and developing their skills in various technical fields that Learning technology today is getting the skills required for the future and increasing opportunities in tomorrow's world. We empower junior to develop their computational and personal skills to match their talents and abilities, in a challenging environment that unleash their creativity.

The main objective of the ITI Junior Academy is to introduce juniors to various tracks of technology and provide them with a solid foundation in technical knowledge. The program covers a wide range of topics, including Artificial Intelligence, Cyber Security, Embedded Systems, Digital Arts (2D Graphic Design,2D Animation) and Architecture Design. Through a combination of interactive sessions, practical exercises, and hands-on projects, participants gain a comprehensive understanding of these subjects.

This journey is structured to ensure a balance between theoretical learning and practical application. Participants learn key concepts and principles through engaging lectures and demonstrations, followed by opportunities to apply their knowledge in real-world scenarios. This approach enables juniors to grasp theoretical concepts while simultaneously honing their problem-solving and critical thinking skills.feesFully Funded ScholarshipGraduates2k GraduatesDuration2 WeeksWho is eligible to applyGender :Males and FemalesNationality :EgyptianMilitary Service :UnknownEducational Degree :All education degrees are allowed.Download Student GuideOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

 ProgramsJunior Camps - (Junior Academy)Program DescriptionITI Junior Academy is a specialized training initiative designed for young individuals who are interested in exploring and developing their skills in various technical fields that Learning technology today is getting the skills required for the future and increasing opportunities in tomorrow's world. We empower junior to develop their computational and personal skills to match their talents and abilities, in a challenging environment that unleash their creativity.

The main objective of the ITI Junior Academy is to introduce juniors to various tracks of technology and provide them with a solid foundation in technical knowledge. The program covers a wide range of topics, including Artificial Intelligence, Cyber Security, Embedded Systems, Digital Arts (2D Graphic Design,2D Animation) and Architecture Design. Through a combination of interactive sessions, practical exercises, and hands-on projects, participants gain a comprehensive understanding of these subjects.

This journey is structured to ensure a balance between theoretical learning and practical application. Track DescriptionA brief description about trackThe Industrial Automation track covers topics such as control systems, programmable logic controllers (PLCs), human-machine interfaces (HMIs), industrial networks, and robotics. Participants gain practical experience in designing, implementing, and troubleshooting automation solutions for manufacturing, process control, and industrial monitoring applications. 17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsTelco-Cloud EngineeringHome>Intake 46>Telco-Cloud EngineeringTrack DescriptionA brief description about trackTelco-Cloud engineering track focuses on next-gen wireless networks, blending cutting-edge AI/ML tools and cloud technologies  in the telecom domain. The curriculum equips learners with cutting-edge skills in Cloud RAN (CRAN) and Open RAN (ORAN) technologies. Graduates will master 5G RAN deployment and automation, preparing them for roles in 5G network design, CRAN and ORAN engineering, and telco-cloud analytics. Industry-aligned projects ensure readiness for emerging telecom standards.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackWireless Communications EngineerCloud-RAN EngineerOpen-RAN Engineerdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsGame ProgrammingHome>Intake 46>Game ProgrammingTrack DescriptionA brief description about trackThe Game Programming track trains individuals in game development, starting with basic common concepts and advancing to state-of-the-art engines. It covers not just mobile, console, and PC, but also extended reality (VR/AR). Graduates can apply their skills to simulations, architecture, education, and more. The track includes learning advanced game engines (Unity, Unreal) and programming languages (C++ and C#), equipping graduates with versatile capabilities beyond traditional gaming.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackGame DesignerGame ProgrammerUnity DeveloperXR ProgrammerUnreal DeveloperEngine Programmerdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsGame ArtHome>Intake 46>Game ArtTrack DescriptionA brief description about trackThe Game Art track focuses on training individuals in the field of game art and visual content design for games. It covers various aspects such as character design, environment design, object design, animation, texturing, and concept art. Participants will gain practical skills in creating visually stunning game assets, understanding game aesthetics, and utilizing industry-standard software and tools. The track emphasizes hands-on projects in the context of game development.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackConcept ArtistGame DesignerTechnical ArtistEnvironment ArtistCharacter ArtistGame AnimatorXR Artistdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsVFX CompositingHome>Intake 46>VFX CompositingTrack DescriptionA brief description about trackThe VFX Compositing track covers topics such as green screen keying, rotoscoping, tracking, color grading, and integrating computer-generated imagery (CGI) into live-action footage. Participants gain practical experience in creating seamless and realistic visual effects by combining multiple elements and enhancing the overall visual quality of films, advertisements, and other media productions. The track emphasizes industry-standard software and techniques used in VFX compositing.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackMatch Moving ArtistVFX on SetVFX CompositorVFX matte painting ArtistColor Grading Artistdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNews3D FX Dynamics and SimulationHome>Intake 46>3D FX Dynamics and SimulationTrack DescriptionA brief description about trackThe FX Dynamics and Simulation track focuses on training individuals in the field of special effects (FX) dynamics and simulation. It covers various aspects such as physics-based simulation, particle systems, fluid dynamics, cloth simulation, rigid body dynamics, and destruction effects. Participants will gain practical experience in using industry-standard software and tools for creating realistic and visually appealing visual effects.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackProcedural ModelerFX Dynamics and Simulation ArtistCharacter FX ArtistCrowd Simulation ArtistFX TD ArtistHoudini Pipeline Render Artistdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNews3D GeneralistHome>Intake 46>3D GeneralistTrack DescriptionA brief description about trackThe 3D Generalist track encompasses a broad range of skills in (CGI). It involves expertise in modeling, texturing, rigging, animation, lighting, and rendering. A 3D Generalist is proficient in software like Autodesk Maya, 3ds Max, and Blender, and is capable of creating high-quality 3D assets for various industries including film, television, gaming, and advertising. They possess a versatile skill set that enables them to contribute to all stages of the 3D production pipeline.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the track3D Environment ArtistCharacter FX ArtistTexturing ArtistLighting Artist3D Look Development Artist3D Character ArtistHard Surface Modelerdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

Participants gain practical experience in creating and managing CG assets, implementing advanced rendering techniques, and optimizing the overall visual quality of computer-generated imagery (CGI). Participants also learn about scripting and programming languages to automate tasks and enhance efficiency in CG workflows.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackFX TD ArtistCharacter TD ArtistRendering TD ArtistPipeline Technical Directordownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

Participants gain practical experience in managing and supporting various types of computer systems, including servers, networks, and operating systems. Participants also learn about backup and recovery strategies, virtualization, cloud computing, and monitoring systems to optimize system performance and availability.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackSystem AdministratorDevops EngineerComputer Networks Engineerdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsCyber SecurityHome>Intake 46>Cyber SecurityTrack DescriptionA brief description about trackThis track focuses on teaching participants the principles of securing digital systems and networks from cyber threats. It covers topics such as network security, cryptography, ethical hacking, incident response, and risk management. Participants will gain hands-on experience in identifying vulnerabilities, implementing security measures, and mitigating risks. The track emphasizes best practices for protecting data, ensuring privacy, and maintaining the integrity of information systems.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackCyber Security OfficerCyber Incident ResponderPenetration Testerdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

It covers topics such as cloud computing models, scalability, security, and cost optimization. Participants will gain hands-on experience with cloud platforms and services, enabling them to design and deploy scalable and resilient cloud solutions. The track also emphasizes best practices for managing and optimizing cloud infrastructure to meet business objectives.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackData Center EngineerDevops EngineerCloud Support Engineerdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsGeoinformaticsHome>Intake 46>GeoinformaticsTrack DescriptionA brief description about trackThe GeoInformatic (GIS) track focuses on training individuals in the field of spatial data analysis and mapping. It covers topics such as GIS software, spatial databases, geospatial analysis, cartography, and remote sensing. Participants gain practical experience in manipulating and analyzing geographic data, creating maps, and utilizing GIS tools for decision-making and problem-solving. The track emphasizes hands-on projects of industry-standard GIS techniques and tools.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackGIS AnalystGIS Developerdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsERP ConsultingHome>Intake 46>ERP ConsultingTrack DescriptionA brief description about trackThe ERP Consulting track involves providing expertise and guidance in implementing and improving Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems in organizations. It includes assessing enterprise needs, analyzing processes, and recommending suitable ERP system implementation and configuration. The track encompasses user training, documentation development, project monitoring, and change management. It requires deep technical knowledge of popular ERP systems.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackSAP ABAB DeveloperSAP Controlling ConsultantSAP Financial ConsultantSAP Material Management ConsultantSAP Sales & Distribution Consultantdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

The track encompasses user training, documentation development, project monitoring, and change management. It requires deep technical knowledge of popular ERP systems. It covers topics such as data modeling, database design, data integration, data governance, and data quality management. Participants will gain practical skills in data manipulation, storage, retrieval, and analysis. The track emphasizes best practices for ensuring data accuracy, consistency, security, and compliance with regulatory requirements.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackBig Data EngineerData Integration SpecialistData Warehouse ModelerData EngineerBI Analyst/Developerdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

It covers topics such as data exploration, data preprocessing, statistical analysis, machine learning, and data visualization. Participants will gain hands-on experience with popular tools and languages used in data science. The track emphasizes practical application of data science techniques in solving real-world problems, extracting insights from data, and making data-driven decisions.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackBig Data AnalystData AnalystData Scientistdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsCloud Platform DevelopmentHome>Intake 46>Cloud Platform DevelopmentTrack DescriptionA brief description about trackThis track focuses on teaching participants the skills and techniques required to develop applications and services on cloud platforms. It covers topics such as cloud-native architecture, containerization, microservices, serverless computing, and DevOps practices. Participants will gain hands-on experience in building, deploying, and managing applications in a cloud environment. The track emphasizes best practices for scalability, reliability, and cost optimization in cloud platform development.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackCloud Application DeveloperDevops EngineerBack-End Developerdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

Participants gain hands-on experience in building Java-based applications, implementing secure authentication and authorization, and deploying applications to production environments.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackFull Stack Web DeveloperSoftware DeveloperBack-End DeveloperJava Developerdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

It covers cross-platform frameworks, hybrid app development, UI design, and deployment. Participants gain hands-on experience for building and deploying apps across platforms, focusing on code reusability and consistent user experience.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackCross Platform Mobile Application DeveloperMean Stack DeveloperMERN Stack DeveloperReact Native DeveloperFlutter DeveloperXamarin Developerdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

Participants learn to design scalable and maintainable software systems, implement efficient algorithms, and ensure data integrity and security. The track emphasizes the integration of software components and the alignment of development practices with architectural principles.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackFront-End DeveloperFull Stack Web DeveloperMean Stack DeveloperSolution ArchitectureBack-End Developerdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsAI and Machine LearningHome>Intake 46>AI and Machine LearningTrack DescriptionA brief description about trackThe AI and Machine Learning track provides a comprehensive understanding of AI and its applications. It covers concepts like supervised/unsupervised learning, neural networks, deep learning, and natural language processing. Practical aspects include data preprocessing, model evaluation, and optimization. Participants gain hands-on experience and a solid foundation in AI principles. Prerequisites: basic programming, statistics, and linear algebra.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackMachine Learning EngineerArtificial Intelligence EngineerNatural Language Processing (NLP) EngineerComputer Vision EngineerGenerative AI EngineerPrompt EngineerDeep Learning EngineerMLOps Engineerdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

Master various testing roles, from functional testers ensuring software behaves as intended, to automation testers streamlining processes with code.  Identify bugs like a pro, guarantee functionality, and champion user satisfaction. 17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsIndustrial AutomationHome>Round 2 25-26>Industrial AutomationTrack DescriptionA brief description about trackIndustrial Automation Specialization  is a product based program. You will gain essential knowledge in industrial  automation field. Design, implement  and validate your industrial solution will be your main objective. Different controller and monitoring systems as Programmable Logic Control (PLC), Human Machine Interface (HMI) and Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) will be delivered. Beside that different instrumentation and maintenance techniques will be covered intensively.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackMaintenance Automation EngineerPLC and SCADA Engineerdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNews3D character ArtistHome>Round 2 25-26>3D character ArtistTrack DescriptionA brief description about track3D Character Artists create 3D models of characters for films video games and Ads. Models are often based on original concept art. Character Artists create 3D characters, creatures, or objects that are integrated into live-action.
In this track, students will study an introduction to 3D art and 3D modeling and then learn digital sculpting of characters and character FX and apply that to produce characters ready for Media Production.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the track3d Artistdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsFurniture VisualizationHome>Round 2 25-26>Furniture VisualizationTrack DescriptionA brief description about trackThis program aims to provide the participants with a wide and detailed knowledge of the inspiring world of furniture visualization. From the History of Furniture visualization to the concepts of choosing materials, and giving them the ability to draw and conceptualize three-dimensional objects.
This program will provide the participants as well with the skills needed to start their own business, enter a new career and take part in a furniture visualization competition.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackFurniture VisualizerTechnical Visualization Specialist3D Artist for Furniture and Interior Designdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global

17002ITIinfo@iti.gov.egHomeAbout ITIServicesPost GraduatesUnder GraduatesTech-BusinessTech AmbassadorsJuniorsMahara-TechWazeefa-TechITI Freelancing InitiativeBranchesNewsUI/UX DesignHome>Round 2 25-26>UI/UX DesignTrack DescriptionA brief description about trackUI/UX Design Specialization - is a product based program that will empower you to learn  User Experience Design which simplifies the design of any product for users. Its target is “Don’t make the user think or become confused while using the product”.  It defines users needs according to their segmentations. Then builds a wireframe that gives a reliable idea of where everything will eventually go. UX Design performs usability testing.Offered Job ProfilesThe following job profiles are available through the trackUX DesignerUI/UX DesignerUX researcherdownload Track infoOver 30  years, ITI has kept updating its training portfolio through continuous monitoring for the future global
